utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey you guys?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know it’s last minute, but we decided to have a Halloween party.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh good!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And everybody has to wear costumes. Come on! It’ll be fun!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’ll-I’ll be there. I mean I have to wear a costume to all my classes that day anyway so…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Please tell me you’re not gonna dress up like a dinosaur.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Not two years in a row.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, I’ll come to the party but I’m not dressing up.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You have to!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No way! Look, Halloween is so stupid! Dressing up, pretending to be someone you’re not…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re an actor!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So Ross, are you gonna bring Mona?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I think I will.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That hot girl from their wedding?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well hey-hey if she needs any idea for costumes, she could be a bikini model, or a slutty nurse, or a sexy cheerleader huh—Ooh-ooh, Leatherface from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre—No-no-no! Slutty Leatherface.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Now wasn’t Joey hitting on her at the wedding too?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s right! He was hitting on her, and I got her. I guess the better man won. Please don’t take her from me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ursula! Wait! Err-err, it’s me! Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Oh, I thought there was a mirror there. Okay, bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait a second! So, what’s new with you?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Umm, nothing. I mean, I’m getting married next week.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah, it’s gonna be a small ceremony. Just family. His.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh. Okay. Well, I’m really happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Wait! If umm, if you want to come, I guess that’d be okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Sure! Why not? You could be my sister for the day.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay. Umm, y’know, my friends are having a Halloween party tonight at my old apartment so, you could come. Maybe I could meet the guy you’re marrying.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Huh. Well, I’m supposed to be working at the restaurant tonight. I’m supposed to be working right now, so who cares.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: By the way, it’s a costume party.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Oh! Okay, so that’s why you’re…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. But thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait! You’re supposed to wear a costume!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am! I am a woman who spent a lot of money on a dress and she wants to wear it, because soon she won’t be able to fit into it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ahh!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m Catwoman, who wants to borrow the dress when you’re too big for it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Trick or treat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Oh! Can I give out the candy? I really want to be with the kids right now. Y’know, ever since I got pregnant I-I have the strongest maternal instincts.

utterance.speaker: Kids
utterance.content: Trick or treat!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just a minute!!! Look at you guys! Wow! You are a very scary witch.

utterance.speaker: Witch
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you are a very funny clown.

utterance.speaker: Clown
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And you are so in style right now. Y’know, I work at Ralph Lauren and the whole fall line has got this like equestrian theme going on. I don’t suppose you saw the cover of British Vogue, but…

utterance.speaker: Cowgirl
utterance.content: Can I just have the candy?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Sure.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ah, Catwoman. So we meet again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So we do Supergirl.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, it’s me. Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Monica! Can I talk to you for a second? Listen, I appreciate you getting me the costume…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you did this to him?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! I thought he’d love it! His favorite kid's book was the Velveteen Rabbit!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The Velveteen Rabbit was brown and white!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it was either a pink bunny or no bunny at all.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No bunny at all!! Always no bunny at all!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You didn’t dress up either?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes I did! I’m Chandler. Dude, what happened?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How is that me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. I’m Chandler

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That is so you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: When have I ever done that?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: When have I ever done that?!

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Trick or treat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! Well you’re just the prettiest ballerina I’ve ever seen.

utterance.speaker: Ballerina
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh wow! That deserves another piece of candy.

utterance.speaker: Ballerina
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I have to say that earns tutu pieces of candy.

utterance.speaker: Ballerina
utterance.content: I love you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh… Oh, honey here. Take it all. Monica! We need more candy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! There’s only been like four kids.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah I know, but one of them just said that she loved me so I just gave her everything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No wonder your pregnant.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you supposed to be?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Remember the Russian satellite, Sputnik? Well, I’m a potato or a…spud. And these are my antennae. So Sputnik, becomes… Spud-nik. Spudnik!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! I don’t have the worst costume anymore!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey all right, Ross came as doody.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I-I’m not doody.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, space doody!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Aren’t you gonna give me a kiss?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, I will. But right after you tell me who the hell you are.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Ursula?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ursula’s fiancée?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh my God, you’re the sister!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Okay, I just slapped my future sister-in-law’s ass.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I’m an idiot. Uh, is your mother here? Maybe I can give her a little slap on the butt.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My mother killed herself.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: She, now I knew that and…now I’m sweating. Look at me, I’m really sweating—Now I’m saying, "Look at me," I’m getting even sweatier. I think I probably should go.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No-no! That’s okay, we’ll just start over. Okay? Hi! I’m Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Eric.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why are you looking at me like that?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: ‘Cause the sweat’s getting in my eyes and its burning.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay. So, what are you?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I don’t think they have a name for it. It’s just I get nervous; I start sweating like crazy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No I-I meant your costume.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh umm, I’m the solar system. Yeah, my students helped me make it—I teach the second grade.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I love the second grade!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! It’s so much better than first grade when you don’t know what’s going on and definitely better than third grade. Y’know with all the politics and mind games.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: So what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, I’m a masseuse…by day.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Y’know you don’t have to stand here with me, believe me…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No I’m having fun. I’m really—And I’m really-really excited for you and Ursula.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh I feel very lucky, she’s great. I think she’s the most beautiful woman I’ve ever seen.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You read comic books right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Exclusively.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Who do you think would win in a fight, Catwoman or Supergirl?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Catwoman, hands down.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But between you and Phoebe, I’d have to give the edge to Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! Really?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Are you kiddin’? Phoebe lived on the street. Okay? Plus, she’s got this crazy temper. She—She’s not standing right behind me is she?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No you’re fine. All right well, do you think I could take Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! Come on I am tough! Punch me right here! As hard as you can!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Will you relax?! What are you taking this so seriously for? It doesn’t matter.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh really? Okay? Well what would you say if I told you that, y’know, Ross or Chandler could beat you up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I would say, "Woman, please!"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Ursula’s fiancée is really sweet! He’s a teacher, he does all this volunteer work. Y’know normally y’know, I don’t like really sweaty guys. But this one? I could just mop him up!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God, Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re getting a crush on your sister’s fiancée.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No I’m not! You are!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here comes the temper.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Trick or treat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Y’know what honey, we’re actually out of candy right now. But someone just went out to get some and I have been giving out money but I’m out of that too. Hey, can I write you a check?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Lelani Mayolanofavich.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, I’m just gonna write this out to cash.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Mona!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Joey’s gonna be thrilled! He was hoping you’d come by as a slutty nurse.

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Umm, actually I’m just a nurse.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’d think that would embarrass me, but you see I’m maxed out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You made it!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Wait-wait! You’re umm, you’re a potato…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I’m a spud…

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: And the antennae…Oh my God you’re Spudnik!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Marry her.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, here’s a good one for ya. Who do think would win in a fight between Ross and Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t answer that! Chandler’s my husband.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So Ross?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Hey beautiful.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hello handsome. Oh God. Oh look at you two. So when did you guys meet?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Two weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Two weeks? That’s it?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Yeah, I know it sounds crazy, and it’s not like me to do something so impulsive, but she’s just so perfect, and we have so much in common.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh really?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: We’re both teachers.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: And we were both in the Peace Corps.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Peace Corps, really?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: In fact when we were building houses in Uruguay, we were, we were just two towns apart and we never met.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah. It wasn’t a town when I got there, but it was a town when I left. Shall we get me really drunk?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Howdy doody.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s funny. Yeah. Y’know you’re the funniest man here in a pink bunny costume his wife made him wear.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh relax man, relax. You’re looking a little flushed.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey-hey-hey, I think we might find out the answer to our question.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What question?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Monica and I were talking about who could kick whose ass in a fight, you or Ross?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: There’s no question.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So you think Ross too?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You picked Ross?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross is really strong! Okay, he’s the strongest out of all three of you! Except for Joey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I cannot believe you didn’t pick me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh, in her defense, she’s right. I am stronger. I would destroy you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh really?! You think you’re stronger? Why don’t you prove it?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh I’ll prove it! I’ll prove it like a theorem!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait-wait!! Okay, stop it! Stop it! Stop! Now listen, no one’s gonna fight in this apartment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Monica! People came to see a fight, let’s give ‘em what they came for!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Hey, you guys could arm wrestle.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Listen to the slutty nurse.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re going down.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah? You’re going further down! Downtown!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Seriously guys, the trash talk is embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh Gunther! You brought candy! Thank you so much for picking this up! You are so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Honey, someday you are gonna make some man the luckiest guy in the world.

utterance.speaker: Kid
utterance.content: Trick or treat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Gotta go! Hi! Wow! There you go!

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: My friend Lewis told me you were giving out money.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, we were but umm, now we’ve got candy.

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: I’d rather have the money.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, that-that’s not your choice. Happy Halloween!

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: This isn’t fair.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well is it fair that all you did was put on a cape and I gotta give you free stuff?

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You shut up!

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: You can’t tell me to shut up!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, I think I just did. And uh-oh, here it comes again. Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah I know—I’m good—I got it! Now wait a minute, I’ve got one more thing I have to say to you…oh right! Shut up!

utterance.speaker: Boy in the Cape
utterance.content: You’re a mean old woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! Wait no! Shut up—I mean don’t cry! Let me get my checkbook!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look honey, you don’t have to do this, okay? It’s the strength you have inside that means the most to me. You’re loyal, you’re honest, and you have integrity! That’s the kind of strength that I want in the man that I love!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That means nothing to me. Come on!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi liar!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y’know the only reason he’s marrying you is because he thinks all the things you were saying about yourself were true.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Well they could be true.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But they’re not!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a fine line huh?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why are you lying to him?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: I don’t know. He said he did all this stuff and then I said I did it too and he got so excited, it was really fun.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Honey?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: It’s a filthy, disgusting habit and I want you to quit now!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: She’s helped so many people to quit smoking.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Y’know, we’d really better get going.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Oh right, you’ve got a church group meeting tonight.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Well, it was nice meeting you.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You too. And Ursula?! It was really nice meeting you tonight!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs come on! Bunny vs. Doody! We’re waiting! Okay. Okay guys, one match, winner take all. Oh wait-wait! What does the winner get?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Pride.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And dignity.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, if you say so. All right, ready? Set! Go!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Wow! They’re both really strong.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Or equally weak.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler’s making his sex face.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, you gettin’ tired?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nope! I can do this all day.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah? Me too. Gettin’ a little tired though.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: God, I’m exhausted.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look this is starting to look really bad for me. Okay? Mona, Mona’s standing right over there. Oh God, she’s talking to Joey! You gotta let me win!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No way! If anything you’ve gotta let me win! My wife thinks I’m a wimp!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, at least you have a wife! I-I keep getting divorces and knockin’ people up! And I’m dressed as doody.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re Spudnik.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, who are we kidding? I’m doody. Please? She’s watchin’.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Fine. Oh no!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah!

utterance.speaker: Mona
utterance.content: Yay! My hero!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re a weird lady.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Hey. Ursula said she left her purse.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: What a relief. It has all the numbers of the people in her prayer chain.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure it does. Yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: Well, I guess I’ll see you at the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm listen, I don’t think…I don’t think I’m gonna make it to the wedding. So I just want to wish you all the luck in the world.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I think we’ll be okay. Besides it’s so perfect and she’s been saving herself for me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay I can’t let you do this! She’s lying to you.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: She is lying! And I bet I can prove it. Excuse me. Okay. Okay. Yeah—Not a prayer chain, but what looks like a detailed drawing of a bank floor plan. Okay, here’s the nametag from the restaurant where she works as a waitress! Not a teacher, a waitress. All right, here’s her driver license, this oughta be good, she always lies about this. How old did she say she was?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: She told me she was 25.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I almost don’t want to show this. Just remember I’m a minute younger.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I am so stupid. Of course she was lying! She’s not a teacher. There’s not such a thing as the top secret elementary school for the children of spies.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. You’re not, you’re not stupid.

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I’m not smart. I just wanted so much to…be impulsive once. To be romantic.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s good, you should be impulsive and you should be romantic. Just…you did it with the wrong person. What?

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: It’s just so weird, two people look so much alike, and so different.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Eric!! Let’s go!!

utterance.speaker: Eric
utterance.content: I’d better go, deal…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, you should.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Hurry up I gotta pray!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Well, I had to give the kid fifty bucks to stop crying.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s not so bad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I also had to go to a couple houses with him as his girlfriend. Oh, I am just awful with children!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on! You’re good with kids. They’re just crazy on Halloween. Y’know, they’re all greedy and hopped up on sugar!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? You think that’s all it is?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Absolutely! Halloween is the worst. Except for Christmas…and their birthdays. Kinda get a little crazy during the summer too. And anytime they’re hungry or sleepy. Y’know, kids are tough. Good luck with that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, I wanted to tell I’m-I’m sorry you lost.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen, I’ve got a secret for ya. I let him win.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is that a secret or a lie.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I let him win—Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Would you tell her I let you win please?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah. Uh Chandler let me win. No, Chandler’s really strong. Oh my arm is so sore. Oh nurse!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am strong! I’ll show you!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler please!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh what’s the matter? Are you scared?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Let’s go big bunny!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. 1…2…3—Go! I’m gonna kill myself!
